title: Bug 38131ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
OB: When running the ajc command to compile Test.java in the subpackage, the resulting test.class file is put in subpackage\subpackage directory.
EB: The expected behavior is to have the same behavior as javac, which would put the test.class in the subpackage directory instead of creating a subpackage\subpackage directory.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Create a class in a subpackage.
2. Compile the class using the command 'ajc subpackage\Test.java'.
3. Note the resulting location of the compiled test.class file.
